content: Yes, absolutely. Trade unions and worker strikes have played a critical role historically in improving working conditions, wages, and benefits for workers across industries. By uniting workers and giving them a collective voice, trade unions have been able to negotiate with employers and drive positive changes in workplaces. Thanks to the efforts of trade unions and workers at the Ford Dagenham plant, conditions improved over time, leading to better lives for workers and their families. It's a testament to the power of collective action and the importance of worker advocacy.
